content:
LoggerVerbosity Enum

Definition

Specifies the available verbosity levels of a Logger.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public enum LoggerVerbosity
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
System.Enum
LoggerVerbosity

Remarks

The descriptions of verbosity levels are only guidelines to how a typical logger (including the default MSBuild console logger) logs build events. Loggers are free to interpret verbosity levels in any way they want.

Fields

Detailed

Detailed verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with MessageImportance values of MessageImportance or MessageImportance, all status events, and a build summary.
Diagnostic

Diagnostic verbosity, which displays all errors, warnings, messages, status events, and a build summary.
Minimal

Minimal verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with MessageImportance values of MessageImportance, and a build summary.
Normal

Normal verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with MessageImportance values of MessageImportance, some status events, and a build summary.
Quiet

Quiet verbosity, which displays a build summary.
